definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The jogger made an analytical analogy between the ecology and geology .
sentences.chinese: 慢跑者在生態學和地質學之間進行了切析類比。

sentences.english: Of course, perhaps even more troubling is the satanic parallel as well.
sentences.chinese: 當然，或許更令人頭疼的是在撒旦身上進行的類比。

sentences.english: Such is analogy's power to make sense of the insensible.
sentences.chinese: 這就是類比在理解無法感覺到的事物中的作用。

sentences.english: We then study the effect of noise on the performance of analog signal transmission.
sentences.chinese: 然後我們討論雜訊對類比信號傳輸品質的影響。

sentences.english: The seventh commenter came in with Nazi analogy employed; Godwin’s law invoked.
sentences.chinese: 七樓用高德溫法則將此文與納粹主義進行類比。

sentences.english: Here, there's an analogy between the music hall and the theater of war.
sentences.chinese: 這裏在音樂禮堂與戰爭電影間有一種類比。

sentences.english: What does that mean? Let me draw two analogies.
sentences.chinese: 那意味着什麼，我爲大家做兩個類比。

sentences.english: Metaphors as a form of reasoning by analogy involve categorization, entailment and inference.
sentences.chinese: 隱喻是一種形式的類比推理涉及分類，蘊涵和推理。
這個類比實在不怎麼樣。

sentences.english: "A car assembly line is an apt analogy, " White said. "Bipedality is the frame.
sentences.chinese: “一條汽車裝配線是一個挺合適的類比，”懷特說。

sentences.english: Okay, so enough with the lame analogy for now.
sentences.chinese: 好了，這個蹩腳的類比到現在已經足夠了。

sentences.english: An analogy from physics might prove helpful in explaining this approach.
sentences.chinese: 物理學上的類比可能有助於解釋這一方法。

sentences.english: Based on analogy reasoning a method of analysing automatic control system was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 類比推理是科學研究中一種重要的手段之一。

sentences.english: Analogical method was used for the pre-evaluation.
I do not think we came up with an agreeable analogy.
sentences.chinese: 我想是我們沒有找到合適的類比。

sentences.english: Well-chosen analogies and metaphors can also help.
sentences.chinese: 貼切的類比和比喻也會有較好的效果。

definition: to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to act in a way that defeats one's purpose (idiom)
